content:
• Tuesday, June 3, 2014
  • AMBA

    Ambarella +3.9% AH on FQ1 beat, in-line guidance

    • Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) guided on its FQ1 CC for FQ2 revenue of $43.5M-$45.5M, in-line with a $44.5M consensus.
    • FQ1 gross margin was 62.7%, -140 bps Q/Q and -130 bps Y/Y, but near the high end of a guidance range of 61%-63% and helping EPS beat by $0.04. GAAP opex rose 19% Y/Y to $19.7M.
    • Strong sales to IP security camera vendors fueled a 21% Y/Y revenue increase, offsetting GoPro-related weakness (previous) caused by camera launch timings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital adds to gains following upbeat CNBC talk

    • After rising 20.7% in regular trading on news of its Samsung deal, InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) is up another 3.4% AH after CEO Bill Merritt provided upbeat comments (video) on CNBC.
    • Merritt states the Samsung pact is "potentially a 10-year deal." He adds the licensing terms mesh with InterDigital's traditional rate structure, and suggests the company is now set to get ~$300M/year in revenue from the 50% of the mobile phone market covered by licensing deals.
    • The deal covers "future generation devices" (e.g. 5G) through 2017. InterDigital is now hoping to reach "a comprehensive agreement" with Apple.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM
  • ANAD

    Anadigics jumps; SA author thinks EBITDA breakeven in sight

    • Though Anadigics (ANAD +7.6%) hasn't turned a profit since 2010, the chipmaker's cost-cutting and mix-optimization efforts leave it in a good position to reach EBITDA break-even in Q3 or Q4, thinks SA author Stock Doctor.
    • The author estimates EBITDA break-even now requires ~$33M/quarter in revenue, down from ~$50M/quarter in 2010. Wi-Fi front end IC and/or power amplifier design wins with the likes of Samsung, Huawei, ZTE, and Coolpad are expected to provide a lift.
    • Stock Doctor adds Anadigics' 0.67 P/S ratio is a fraction of that of peers such as RF Micro, TriQuint, and Skyworks, and thinks a $14M cash balance and $11M credit line mean liquidity isn't a concern.
    • Previous: Anadigics rallies after announcing Wi-Fi PA, design wins
     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell -2.7% AH on $125M shelf filing

    • Maxwell (NASDAQ:MXWL) has filed to sell up to $125M worth of stock, debt, and warrants through future offerings. (prospectus)
    • The ultracapacitor vendor had $32.6M in cash at the end of Q1, and $10.6M in debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 1 Comment

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ZGNX +4.5%. TAST +3.0%. SHOR +3.0%. BTG +2.6%. FWM +2.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TIBX -12.5%. DRL -6.1%. AEC -4.0%. CRZO -3.8%. RLOC -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • ABM

    ABM Industries misses by $0.07, revenue in line

    • ABM Industries (NYSE:ABM): FQ2 EPS of $0.33 misses by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $1.23B (+5.1% Y/Y) in-line.
    • Shares -3.31% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • TIBX

    Tibco resumes trading; shares -12.8% AH

    • Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) has made fresh 52-week lows following its FQ2 warning.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • TIBX

    Tibco issues FQ2 warning, blames Spotfire

    • Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) now expects FQ2 (May quarter) revenue of $250M-$252M and EPS of $0.12-$0.13, below prior guidance of $263M-$271M and $0.20-$0.22, and a consensus of $267.5M and $0.21.
    • Weaker-than-expected sales of the company's Spotfire analytics/data visualization platform are "primarily" to blame. In March, Tibco stated Spotfire, which faces tough competition from Tableau and Qlik, had "performed below plan" in FQ1.
    • The company says core infrastructure (middleware) and event processing software sales rose during the quarter, and that it has "several changes under way" that it thinks will bolster Spotfire's performance.
    • Full FQ2 results arrive on June 19.
    • Shares are halted. They jumped last week following a report stating SAP might be interested in making a bid. If SAP is interested, it might now get a discount.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA): Q1 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $40.92M (+20.6% Y/Y) beats by $0.92M.
    • Shares -2.56% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • AREX

    Approach Resources +2.2% on Global Hunter upgrade

    • Approach Resources (AREX +2.2%) is upgraded to Accumulate from Neutral with a $25 price target, up from $20, at Global Hunter, which believes the worst days are now in the rear-view mirror.
    • AREX's current valuation combined with its asset base, while not capable of the 100% internal rate of return its northern Midland peers possess, still provides 40% IRRs over two prospective zones across a wide swath of continuous acreage, Hunter says.
    • Most important, the firm says, is that AREX's efficiency gains have stepped up considerably in FY 2014, which should translate to a notable improvement in production growth per debt adjusted share.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD +11% even as company says no news pending

    • IAMGOLD (IAG +11.2%) shares popped 15% higher an hour or so ago, apparently based on rumors regarding a Niobec project sale; IAG has held much of the gains even after the company said it had no news pending and its did not know why shares rose.
    • IAG's Niobec mine is North America's only source of pyrochlore, the primary niobium ore and one of only three major producers of niobium in the world.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 6 Comments
  • SNV

    Synovus notches 2nd upgrade in two days

    • Synovus (SNV +2.7%) is ahead for a 2nd straight day after KBW upgrades the stock to Outperform. Yesterday, it was Raymond James which boosted the name to Outperform.
    • Both moves come following the bank's 1:7 reverse stock split in May - one of the reasons for which was to garner more institutional interest.
    • Previously: Synovus sets 1:7 reverse stock split
    • May also saw disclosure of a boosted stake in the lender from Ken Griffin's Citadel Investment.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • TSLX

    TPG Specialty Lending continues post-IPO surge

    • Wells Fargo cashes in its chips on its Outperform rating on TPG Specialty Lending (TSLX +4.1%), but it's not enough to slow down the stock which us up close to 50% since its March IPO.
    • In other news, the company gets $200M in additional commitments to its credit line, bringing the total to $781.3M. The accordion feature allows the line to be built up to nearly $1B.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • BPOP

    Doral's trouble means gains for other Puerto Rico lenders

    • Popular (BPOP +3.8%) and First Bancorp (FBP +4.5%) are posting strong gains in the wake of fellow Puerto Rico lender Doral Financial's (DRL -17.7%) escalating liquidity issues.
    • Both Popular and First Bancorp are no doubt eyeing assets they can maybe pick up on the cheap, and yesterday FBP purchased from Doral servicing rights on mortgages with about $242.1M of UPB.
    • Previously: Doral completes sale of mortgages; evaluating strategic alternatives
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • NFEC

    NF Energy doubles on news of two water works contracts

    • Shares of NF Energy Saving (NFEC +98.7%) nearly double after the manufacturer of energy efficient flow control systems for Chinese power plants says it signed two contracts with the Water Diversion Project for water transferring infrastructure systems in northern China.
    • NFEC agrees to supply $15M of butterfly valve flow control equipment; the orders are expected to be delivered between July 2014 and March 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: NFEC +94%. SARA +44%. OTC:ACFN +33%. ANCI +24%. BIOC +22%. IDCC +20%. THTI +19%. ACHC +14%. AMBR +11%. VTL +11%.
    • Top 10 Losers: ENSG -40%. ZQK -39%. THRX -19%. CLVS -16%. EVRY -16%. VGGL -15%. DRL -15%. KKD -15%. WHZ -13%. OTC:SPDC -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • WLT

    EPA's McCarthy says significant changes possible in carbon plan

    • EPA chief Gina McCarthy says she expects for significant changes in proposed state emission goals before a final rule is issued next year if the individual states show they can’t meet the targets.
    • McCarthy says the agency made changes when developing its rules on mercury pollution in 2012 after utilities complained, and says she "wouldn’t be surprised if we made significant” revisions to the carbon proposal.
    • McCarthy notes "confusion" around the targeted 30% emission cuts, saying it’s not a goal of the plan but an estimate of what the EPA thinks can be achieved.
    • Coal names are broadly lower: WLT -4.4%, ACI -3.7%, ANR -2%, ARLP -1.9%, CNX -1.3%, CLD -0.3%, BTU -0.2%.
    • Big utilities are mostly higher: EXC +1.6%, AEP +1%, NRG +0.7%, D +0.5%, XEL +0.4%, SO +0.3%, PEG +0.2%, NEE +0.1%, DUK -0.2%
    • ETFs: XLE, XLU, TAN, ERX, KOL, IDU, VDE, OIH, ERY, FCG, VPU, DIG, KWT, GASL, DUG, IYE, GASX, PXJ, RYE, FENY, UPW, RYU, FUTY, FXN, FXU, DDG, SDP
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • SARA

    Saratoga Resources +55% as Rocky 3 well exceeds expectations

    • Saratoga Resources (SARA +55.6%) surged after its Rocky 3 development well in Louisiana tested at a gross equivalent rate of 1,531 bbl/day of oil and 240K cf/day of gas, or net 1,288 boe/day.
    • SARA says it is in the process of identifying other horizontal well targets in the same reservoir and looks to drill more wells in the field upon increasing production handling capacity.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • WRLD

    World Acceptance -3.6%; auditor needs more time

    • KPMG notifies World Acceptance (WRLD -3.6%) more time is needed to complete an audit of the company's financials for the fiscal year ending March 31.
    • Reported revenues of 617.6M (up 5.8% Y/Y) and  net income of $106.6M (up 2.4%) are expected to be materially inline with what the audited results will show.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • CBOE

    Disappointing action at CBOE in May

    • VIX futures average daily volume in May of 143,946 fell 19% from April and 1% from a year ago. CFE average daily volume of 144,266 also fell 19% and 1%.
    • The sell-side quickly reacts, with UBS maintaining a Buy rating, but trimming the price target by $1 to $57. Credit Suisse reiterates its Underperform rating and $49 price target.
    • CBOE -3.7%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • OCN

    Ocwen pops on report over gag orders

    • Reuters reports Ocwen Financial (OCN +1.2%) will stop the practice of requiring homeowners promise not to say anything disparaging about the company in exchange for mortgage modifications.
    • Previously: Lawsky continues press on non-bank servicers
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHGG

    Chegg buying tutoring marketplace for $30M; shares gain

    • Chegg (CHGG +3%) is buying InstaEDU, a site that connects students with online tutors handling 2.5K+ subjects, for $30M in cash.
    • InstaEDU screens tutors using a qualification system, and takes a cut of tutoring fees. Rates start at $0.40/minute.
    • The startup's services complement Chegg Study, which provides guided solutions for coursework in partnership with textbook publishers and qualified experts.
    • They also strengthen Chegg's efforts to grow its digital sales (+66% Y/Y in Q1, 24% of revenue), and thus cut its dependence on a slower-growing print textbook rental business (+13% in Q1, 76% of revenue).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • CME

    Tough year-over-year comparisons for CME

    • Overall exchange average volume of 13M contracts in May grows 6% from April, and falls 12% from May 2013.
    • Average interest rate volume of 7.6M contracts per day is up 27% from April, but fell 3% from a year ago (when rates began blowing up). Eurodollar average futures volume of 2.6M contracts is up 10% from a year ago. Treasury futures average volume of 3.6M contracts slides 13% Y/Y.
    • Average equity index volume of 2.2M contracts falls 22% from a year ago, and ag commodities average volume of 915K contracts declines 5%. Metals average volume of 324K contacts falls 27%, and energy of 1.4M is down 18%.
    • CME -1.5%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • RDN

    Radian higher after May delinquency data

    • Primary new insurance written of $2.97B in May compares to $4.56B one year ago. Mortgage activity picks up from very low levels earlier in the spring (the figure had dropped below $2.5B), but is still not close to last year's levels.
    • Ending primary delinquent inventory of 50,212 loans is down from 50,994 in April and 79,344 a year ago.
    • RDN +1.5%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • TPLM

    Triangle Petroleum -4% on Global Hunter downgrade

    • Triangle Petroleum (TPLM -4.2%) falls sharply after Global Hunter downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy after the stock has doubled over the last year, reaching the firm's NAV-based price target of $10/share.
    • Hunter also believes TPLM will have to show that its acreage is capable of generating top-quartile returns in the Bakken in order to warrant upside beyond its price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 4 Comments
  • CLVS

    No love for Clovis

    • The positive buzz from CO-1686 can't seem to pull Clovis Oncology (CLVS -13.9%) out of its funk. Shares have cratered 56% since the March 6 high of $93.33.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage lower following annual meeting

    • Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST -3.3%) track lower after the firm's annual meeting comes and goes without any major product or partnership announcements.
    • Execs indicated during the Q&A session that the company will stick to its strengths this year to protect its brand. The company doesn't want to "jump the shark" by extending too far.
    • Monster Beverage annual meeting webcast
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • GM

    General Motors June U.S. sales

    • General Motors (NYSE:GM) unit sales +12.6% to 284,694 to eclipse estimates for a 6.4% rise.
    • Retail sales increased 10% in May, while fleet sales soared 21%.
    • The automaker anticipates it increased its market share in the U.S. during the month despite the negative headlines tied to the large ignition switch recall.
    • GM +1.5% in early action
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 15 Comments
  • SWKS

    Skyworks +3.6% on FQ3 guidance hike

    • Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) now expects FQ3 revenue of $570M and EPS of $0.80, well above prior guidance of $535M and $0.73, and a consensus of $535.5M and $0.73.
    • The RF component vendor notes it's "capitalizing on the growing opportunity within the Internet of Things" (read: embedded opportunities), and "increasing analog complexity associated with higher data rate connectivity standards" (read: 4G and 802.11ac Wi-Fi). The momentum is expected to last beyond FQ3.
    • Skyworks adds it expects its new Panasonic RF filter JV to deliver at least 100 bps of gross margin accretion in FY15 (ends Sep. '15).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: IDCC +12%. SPEX +9%. HSH +9%. SSLT +5%.
    • Losers: ZQK -42%. CLVS -12%. KKD -11%. OTC:GIGA -9%. BAGL -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital +12.4% on Samsung deal, guidance hike

    • InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) has struck a multi-year, royalty-bearing licensing deal with Samsung related to the use smartphone giant's sale of 3G, 4G, and "certain future generation" devices.
    • The deal ends a long-running dispute with a company estimated by IDC to have 24.5% of the 2013 mobile phone market (in terms of units), and 31.3% of the smartphone market.
    • With the Samsung deal in tow, InterDigital now expects Q2 revenue of $172M-$210M, far above prior guidance of $65M-$72M. Recurring revenue is now expected to be in a range of $72M-$80M (up from $55M-$57M), and revenue from past sales $100M-$130M (up from just $10M-$15M).
    • The company adds that it still only has "roughly have of the market under license," leaving plenty of room for additional recurring revenue growth.
    • 12.3% of the float was shorted as of May 15.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • MLCO

    Macau stocks dip off of weaker-than-expected revenue report

    • Macau-related casino stocks are down in early trading after a report on May revenue in the region comes in below expectations.
    • Previous: Single-digit growth stunner for Macau casinos
    • Premarket: Melco Crown (MPEL) -4.2%, MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) -1.6%, Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) -2.2%, Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) -2.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • AEIS

    Advanced Energy downgraded at Needham on news of CEO transition

    • Advanced Energy Industries (NASDAQ:AEIS) -9.2% premarket after yesterday's announcement that Garry Rogerson has decided to step down as CEO.
    • AEIS is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Needham following the news, as Rogerson is viewed as the key figure in driving the major operational changes to enable strong earnings growth and leverage; the firm is concerned that multiple high-level departures in such a short time could cause major disruption of the business.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • TELL

    Magellan Petroleum to drill two exploration wells during 2014

    • Magellan Petroleum (MPET) +3.6% premarket after announcing plans to drill two exploration wells in the U.K.'s Weald Basin during 2014.
    • The basin southwest of London underlays substantially all of MPET's 347K gross acres of exploration and development licenses in the U.K., and is believed to contain 2.2B-8.6B barrels of oil.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • HSH

    Analysis: Tyson Foods will have to stretch if it wants Hillshire Brands

    • Shares of Hillshire Brands (NYSE:HSH) are up 8.3% to $58 in premarket action as investors bet another offer will come down the pike to top the $55 bid from Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC).
    • Analysts think $55 is close to where Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) thought it could nab Hillshire, indicating the company may have to stretch if it wants to get its quick entry into the breakfast market through Hillshire.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 AM | 1 Comment
